markdown.markdown:
Our Research and Extension Cropping Systems Weed Science Program (WiscWeeds) at the University of Wisconsin-Madison focuses on traditional and agroecologically-based approaches to weed management in corn, soybean, and small grains in Wisconsin farm systems. Our program generates and disseminates research-based information for sustainable weed management (including herbicide-resistant weeds), protecting water quality, increasing food security, and enhancing other agroecosystem services (e.g., farm profitability). Check the [**WiscWeeds Team Program Statement**.](images/headers/UW_WiscWeedsStatement.pdf)

![WiscWeeds team at the 2022 North Central Weed Science Society Meetings, St. Louis, MO, December 07, 2022.](images/headers/WiscWeeds%20NCWSS%202022.JPG){alt="WiscWeeds team at the 2022 North Central Weed Science Society Meetings, St. Louis, MO, December 07, 2022."}
